newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine PM orders privatisation of 6 shipbuilders.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine PM orders privatisation of 6 shipbuilders.

text.p: Ukraine plans to start privatising its six shipbuilding plants this year, Prime Minister Pavlo Lazarenko was quoted as saying in the southern port city of Mykolayiv on Monday.
Mykhailo Titov, head of the Mykolayiv region's press service, told reporters that Lazarenko ordered executives to prepare their factories for privatisation.

"You have to be privatisated so that you stop asking the government for money," Titov quoted Lazarenko as saying at the closed meeting after he rejected a request from two Mykolayiv shipbuilders for 140 million hryvnia.
Lazarenko added that the government will review the sector next month.

The Ministry of Machine-Building, the Military Industrial Complex and Conversion said last year Ukraine fulfilled $168.5 million in orders, exporting 11 ships to Greece, United Arab Emirates, Russia, Liberia and the Philippines.
Ukraine exported 17 vessels with orders totalling $185 million in 1995.
The country's three Mykolayiv plants, the Kerch factory "Zalyv", a plant at Kherson and a small plant at Kiev manufacture tankers, refrigerated carriers and trawlers.
The Machine Building Ministry said previously it planned to build 261 boats by 2000, with 219 of them intended for export.
